Description: Base of vessel from Chian Wild Goat Style pottery kernos with slight remains of body; white slip (mostly worn); interior of vessel black; exterior: tongue pattern on outward facing side of vessel holder and reserved on inward facing side; uncertain motif above, perhaps herringbone; on top of body two verticals to right of probable maeander.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 250, no. 357)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2169) (phase 2)
